title: Reuters Poll: U.S. recovery on track, but jobs growth needs time - economists
text: (This Friday story corrects name to TD Bank Group from TD Securities in paragraph 4)

title: Stock-Picking Is Coming Back: Beschloss
text: Feb.12 -- RockCreek founder and Chief Executive Officer Afsaneh Beschloss says stock-picking is coming back. Willett Advisors Chairman and Chief Executive Officer Steve Rattner thinks individual investors are better off investing in indexes, but agrees that earnings are largely preserved, with most S&P 500 companies beating analysts' earnings estimates.

title: Today's Stock Mania Differs From 1999's, but That Might Not Matter
text: Interest rates and price/earnings multiples are indeed lower than they were two decades ago, but the federal budget is in much worse shape, and a pandemic is bashing the economy. It all could lead to another hard landing for investors.

title: Jim Cramer's game plan for the trading week of Feb. 16
text: "I regard this as the last official week of an earnings season that's been far, far better than anyone expected," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Cramer's week ahead: Earnings season has been 'far better' than expected
text: "A day with less froth, like today, is a day where the rally feels more sustainable," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Cramer: A day with less froth is a day where the rally feels more sustainable
text: "If the cannabis cohort and the short-busters and the incredible pumping and dumping I am seeing on the web is coming back, well you know I'm going to have to get more negative," the "Mad Money" host said.

title: Wall Street's SPAC craze scales new heights with record filings
text: Richard Branson and Barry Sternlicht were among more than two dozen investor groups that filed with U.S. regulators on Friday to raise new blank-check acquisition companies, setting a new record.

title: The Stock Market's Laggards Will Bounce Back -- but When?
text: A late-day move higher took Wall Street to new records.

title: US Indexes End at New Highs Friday
text: The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed at 31,458.40 on Friday with a gain of 27.70 points or 0.09%. The S&P 500 closed at 3,934.83 for a gain of 18.45 points or 0.47%.

title: Stimulus prospects could boost the stock market and interest rates in the week ahead
text: The prospects of a big government spending program could continue to boost the stock market and put upward pressure on interest rates in the week ahead.

title: Nuveen's Saira Malik: We're far from overheating in markets
text: Nuveen's managing director and head of global equity Saira Malik says she believes we're far from an overheating in the markets right now. The most important factors will be volatility and strong earnings growth that will drive markets higher in 2021, she said.

title: The Dow Rose 23 Points to a Record Because We'll Have Plenty of Vaccine Doses
text: All three major U.S. stock indexes closed at record highs after the Biden administration said the majority of Americans could be vaccinated by summer.

title: In the Inflation/Reflation Debate, Gold Could Win
text: By Joe Foster, Portfolio Manager, Gold Strategy, VanEck Reflation Trade Gold had a strong start to the year, moving to its monthly high of $1,959 per ounce on January 6 at the same time the U.S. dollar index (DXY)[1] made fresh three-year lows. However, gold quickly reversed course as it became clear the democrats had won [.

title: Morgan Stanley's Jim Lacamp we should be cautious of inflation
text: Jim Lacamp, Morgan Stanley Wealth Management senior vice president, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss what factors would make him worried about inflation in the near future.

title: Tiger 21 Poll: Wealthy investors moving cash off sidelines
text: Michael Sonnenfeldt, Tiger21 founder, joins 'Power Lunch' to discuss where wealthy investors are putting their money right now and how they are thinking about bitcoin.

title: Earnings Estimates Keep Going Up
text: Earnings growth was expected to resume in the first quarter of 2021 after the pandemic-driven declines of 2020. But positive growth has arrived a little earlier, with earnings in the ongoing Q4 earnings season now modestly above the year-earlier period.

title: Stock Market Today: Blue-Chip Indices Close Out the Week on Top
text: The Dow and other major indices managed to scratch out new all-time highs with modest gains in a quiet Friday session.

title: VIX 'fear gauge' ends below 20 for first time in nearly a year
text: The Cboe Volatility Index, known as Wall Street's "fear gauge," ended below 20 for the first time in nearly a year on Friday.

title: Former Pimco CEO Mohamed El-Erian on his market outlook and bitcoin
text: Mohamed El-Erian, former PIMCO CEO and Allianz chief economic advisor, joins 'Closing Bell' to discuss his market outlook and whether he sees a market top on its way.

title: Traders find a second wind before the close, cap off strong week with another positive day
text: 4:10pm: Major indices sneak into the green The Dow finished up 28 points, less than 0.1%, at a record high close of 31,459 after being down most of the Friday session. The Nasdaq improved 70 points, 0.5%, to 14,095, and the S&P 500 picked up 18 points, 0.5%, to 3,935.

title: Stock market clinches trifecta of record closing highs ahead of Presidents Day holiday
text: Major U.S. stock indexes on Friday finished on a higher note, notching a series of record highs on the back of optimism about a fresh round of COVID spending, strong corporate earnings and progress in rollowuts of vaccines to combat the viral pandemic. The Dow Jones Industrial Average closed up less than 0.1% to end at around 31,458, enough for a record peak for the blue-chip index, aided by gains in Goldman Sachs Group Inc. and Amgen Inc..

title: SPX: The Equity Risk Premium Is Still Not High Enough Despite Ultra Low Rates
text: It is very common to hear bulls argue that the SPX pays a higher yield than bonds and offer much more potential for capital gains, therefore justifying being long. The problem is that stocks have almost always returned much more than bonds, and usually by a wider margin than implied by the current dividend yields and growth outlook.

title: US stocks close at record highs as traders weigh recovery optimism against valuation concerns
text: US stocks closed at all-time highs on Friday as the month's rally charged on. Momentum from Thursday's session continued, as investors weighed whether stocks have room to move higher. While Democrats are pushing forward with a $1.9 trillion relief package, stretched valuations and lasting pain in the labor market stand to curb further gains.

title: Fed's Powell Says Real Jobless Rate Is 10%—With Big Policy Implications
text: Federal Reserve Chairman Jerome Powell has offered a sobering assessment of the U. S. economic prospects as the Covid pandemic rages: the actual unemployment rate when accounting for crisis-related exits from the labor force is closer to 10%.

title: A Tiny Drop in the ‘Fear Gauge' Could Boost Stocks. Watch This Number.
text: The CBOE Volatility Index has fallen 27% since late September, when a fresh rally in stocks began.

title: The Stock Market Faces Its Moment Of Truth As Inflation Rises Over The Horizon
text: Inflation expectations have been steadily rising in recent months. The S&P 500 has been closely tracking that trend higher.

title: Friendly fire erupts as economists spar over U.S. stimulus
text: It's not surprising U.S. President Joe Biden's $1.9 trillion coronavirus emergency plan touched off concerns that a gusher of federal spending on the possible eve of a vaccine-fueled economic take-off might lead to inflation.

title: ‘Bloomberg Real Yield': Is There an Asset Shortage?
text: Feb.12 -- Jeffrey Rosenberg, systematic fixed income senior portfolio manager at BlackRock, discusses liquidity, inflation expectations, and the challenging environment for portfolio construction. He speaks with Bloomberg's Jonathan Ferro on "Bloomberg Real Yield.

title: An Update on 2021's Euphoric Sentiment
text: A few weeks ago, we checked in on how investor sentiment  was looking for the New Year through a handful of useful indicators.

title: Here's What Biden's $2 Trillion Climate-Focused Infrastructure Plan Means For Stocks And The Economy
text: Economists have warned failing to address climate change could tank GDP by 25% this century.

title: Bear markets do not start without higher interest rates and less friendly Fed, says Ron Insana
text: Ron Insana, Schroders North America senior advisor, and Michael Farr, President and CEO of Farr, Miller and Washington join 'Power Lunch' to discuss the state of the market and their outlook for 2021.

title: Long-Term Treasury Yields Keep Rising. Why the 10-Year Could Climb to 1.5%.
text: Strategists at Oxford Economics say that the benchmark 10-year Treasury yield could rise to or above 1.5% over the next few months.

title: Stocks Cruising Up the Charts Through February
text: This week kicked off with a bang, and virtually no sign that the extreme market volatility of last week had ever occurred.

title: 10-year Treasury yield breaks above key level of 1.2%
text: The 10-year Treasury yield broke above 1.2% on Friday afternoon, ending days of speculation when the benchmark maturity would manage to surpass that key ceiling on back of expectations for stronger inflation this year. The 30-year bond yield also passed its own significant level of 2%.

title: This Dot-Com Parallel May Signal When Stock-Market Mania Is Ending
text: I'm sure some sell-side volatility analyst has used this corny turn of phrase before, but the only thing investors have to fear right now is lack of fear itself.

title: U.S. Senate Republicans ask SEC to reject Nasdaq diversity rules
text: Republican members of the U.S. Senate's Banking Committee on Friday urged securities regulators to reject corporate diversity rules proposed by Nasdaq Inc.

title: US consumer sentiment takes a hit despite promises of more stimulus
text: American households making less than $75,000 are feeling especially pessimistic about their financial futures, despite promises of more federal stimulus measures in the coming months, according to the latest University of Michigan's consumer sentiment survey.

title: Stock Market Rally, Bitcoin Hit Record Highs; Disney, GM, Tilray, Canopy Growth In Focus
text: The stock market rally rose and Bitcoin surged, both to new highs. Marijuana stocks Tilray and Canopy Growth soared on good news but then tumbled.

title: The Tell: Here's how much U.S. fiscal stimulus investors are penciling in right now
text: Investors expect Congress to pass another round of relief spending that will come in below but near President Joe Biden's proposed $1.9 trillion package, according to a Deutsche Bank survey.

title: Can The Fed Both Tap on the Brakes and Floor the Gas?
text: Fed speakers repeatedly promise policy tightening is a story for next year or the year after. To quote Jerome Powell – “We're not thinking about raising rates, we're not even thinking about thinking about raising rates.

title: Congress To Dig Into Reddit Squeeze; Walmart, Shopify Report: Investing Action Plan
text: Lawmakers will hold a hearing on short squeezes that saw GameStop and other stocks swing wildly, and how trading platforms like Robinhood responded. The post Congress To Dig Into Reddit Squeeze; Walmart, Shopify Report: Investing Action Plan appeared first on Investor's Business Daily.

title: The Fed Just Released New Hypothetical Scenarios for Bank Stress Tests in 2021
text: The results from the Fed's stress testing help determine banks' capital requirements, as well as their capital distribution plans.

text: Proposals from Sen. Amy Klobuchar and others to make M&A harder could throw "sand in the gears" of the Covid economic recovery, argues one antitrust lawyer.
